title: Weeee!!!
text:
Don't let the name fool you, 8 ball is much more than a game of pool. It is more like a reflex testing gobstopper where 8 ball is at the center. A game of pool is in the center of multiple layers of click bate purchasing opportunities that flash under your unsuspecting finger! It's fun… 

Honestly though, I play it a lot despite the annoying “bate and switch” interface, it is addictive.

title: Great game but…
text: The gameplay and and game interface is excellent. You can tell they put some time money and effort in to this game. You can also tell that they’re trying to squeeze every dollar they can out of this “free” game. The in-game purchases are marketed super aggressively from the start. In between games windows constantly pop up trying to sell you on something. In fact, they pop up so quickly and without notice that you will unintentionally click on them and be transported to a payment confirmation screen before you know it. Good luck not getting charged. If you have kids you better unlink any cards, fast!

title: Needs Serious Re-write
text: Such a shame, could be really great fun if the developers would fix their algorithm to make the balls roll true. Unfortunately I’m done with this game. It’s just too frustrating to play two or three games and have over a dozen scratches, watching the cue ball curve towards pockets with unrealistic curvature, pockets acting like black holes seemingly sucking the cue ball in with no the or reason. Even the most amateur players I. Real life don’t scratch ten times a game, but it happens here - often. Balls rolling with plenty of momentum suddenly stop- right behind another ball leaving players no shot several times a game as well. Clearly some of these things are intentionally programmed into the algorithm to increase difficulty or whatever, but it’s too unrealistic and ruins the gaming experience. Close but no cigar here.
